intro: Oxycoccoides erythrocarpus, commonly known as the red-fruited oxycocca, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and clusters of bright red berries that ripen in the fall. The plant typically grows in acidic, well-drained soils in temperate climates. It is often found in shaded forest understories and rocky habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
